intro: Halodendrum thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Halodendrum thouarsii is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
